message.content: This question requires some knowledge about electrical safety and the conductivity of different materials. Option (A) is the correct answer because masonry, which refers to materials like bricks or concrete, is a non-conductive material. By using masonry, we can prevent the flow of electric current and reduce the risk of electric shock. Option (B) is incorrect because copper is a highly conductive material and would not prevent electric shock. Option (C) is also incorrect because aluminum is a good conductor of electricity. Option (D) is unrelated to electric shock prevention and is referring to dental fillings.

This question requires basic knowledge about electrical safety. Option (B) is incorrect because copper wire is a good conductor of electricity and would not prevent electric shock. Option (C) is also incorrect because aluminum is also a conductor of electricity. Option (D) is unrelated to electrical safety and refers to dental fillings, which are not relevant to preventing electric shock.
